intro: Heliophila linearifolia var. hirsuta, commonly known as hairy slender heliophila, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, linear leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. Its hairy texture on stems and leaves gives it a distinctive appearance and helps in identifying the species.
